#Docker and singularity

Introduction

  1. Docker VS singularity: are both containerization platforms, competitors.
  2. Docker/singularity: manage containers which contain packages, depencies, scripts, even data; Conda: manage virtual environments which contain packages.

Installation

  1. For window, desk-top version of docker is recommended; If we use VPN in mainland China, we had better change DNS of wsl2 and network (wifi/ethernet) into that of Google (8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4)
  2. docker-registry-mirrors for faster download in mainland China

Quickstart

For singularity

 1. We can enter the sif containter by running ‘singularity shell <sif name>’ to explore its content;
 2. And softwares and scripts can been add in the $PATH of the container;
 3. Usually, we can run all commands outside the sif container by add ‘singularity exec’.（To use GPUs, singularity exec --nv custardpy.sif <command>）(For example, when calling loops or run machine learning) 
 4. singularity  exec  --bind  /path/on/host:/path/in/container  /path/to/<sif name> <command > (singularity exec /path/to/singularity_image.sif (if  ‘--bind /path/on/host:/path/in/container’ is omitted ))
 5. If I want to add and execute a scipt in a sif image like custardpy.1.4.sif
    5a. singularity build --sandbox custardpy_sandbox custardpy.1.4.sif
    5b. singularity shell --writable custardpy_sandbox
    5c. cp /home/user/scripts/getdanRer11genome.sh /home/user/sif_images/custardpy_sandbox/opt/scripts_custardPy/
    5d. chmod +x /opt/scripts_custardPy/getdanRer11genome.sh
    5e. exit

For docker

 1. 'docker run -it <image_name> /bin/bash' to explore its content;
 2. docker run -it --rm <image_name> <command>

About me

My name is Pengfei Yin (殷鹏飞). I completed my BSc at the Ocean University of China, where I was deeply attracted to how mechanisms underlying molecular biology are discovered. Since then, I have been systematically enhancing my ability to decipher biological mechanisms. In addition to experiments, numerous scientific studies demonstrate that Physics (Francis Crick) and computational analysis can also help us understand the biological phenomena. Thus, I have developed a background in molecular biology, complemented by training in mathematical modeling and core courses for Physics students (including the 3 volumes of the Feynman Lectures on Physics).

item.description:
Hello, HUGO!

Why?

Inspired by the website of Prof.XiChen, I also want to build my own website using HUGO with gokarna theme. I think it’s a good way to record my thoughts and progresses, as well as a method to present myself. Besides, it can also encourage me to write more, which I think, is quite important to reorganize various pieces of knowledge and assimilate them into my own understanding.

How?

First, install HUGO and download the theme called gokarna. Then I learn the basic rules of building a website using HUGO(Referenc Video)
